headline.main: Sarkozy Praises 'Magic' of the New Palais de Tokyo, Opening Thursday

docs.snippet: France's president toured the Paris museum on Wednesday following a $26 million government-funded renovation that tripled its size, making it one of largest contemporary art spaces in Europe....
docs.abstract: France's president toured the Paris museum on Wednesday following a $26 million government-funded renovation that tripled its size, making it one of largest contemporary art spaces in Europe.

docs.snippet: Mali may be facing protracted partition. It is unclear whether its ill-equipped, demoralized army has the wherewithal to reclaim any ground in the secessionist north. Whether a viable Tuareg state will emerge depends on the junta's response and th...
docs.abstract: Mali may be facing protracted partition. It is unclear whether its ill-equipped, demoralized army has the wherewithal to reclaim any ground in the secessionist north. Whether a viable Tuareg state will emerge depends on the junta's response and the rebels' divisions. Read Frank Jacobs's dissection of the situation on Opinionator»

headline.print_headline: Lucasfilm Cancels Plans For Marin County Studio
headline.main: Lucasfilm Cancels Plans for New Studio in Northern California

docs.snippet: Lucasfilm, the studio behind the "Star Wars" saga, said it would not build a new facility in Marin County, Calif., saying that it feared alienating neighbors and wanted to work with "communities that see us as a creative asset, not as an evil empi...
docs.abstract: Lucasfilm, the studio behind the "Star Wars" saga, said it would not build a new facility in Marin County, Calif., saying that it feared alienating neighbors and wanted to work with "communities that see us as a creative asset, not as an evil empire."

headline.print_headline: U.S. Sues Apple and Publishers Over E-Book Pricing
headline.main: Justice Dept. Sues Apple and Publishers Over E-Book Pricing; 3 Publishers Settle

docs.snippet: The Justice Department filed an antitrust lawsuit charging that Apple and others colluded to raise the price of e-books in 2010. Several publishers have agreed to a settlement....
docs.abstract: The Justice Department filed an antitrust lawsuit charging that Apple and others colluded to raise the price of e-books in 2010. Several publishers have agreed to a settlement.

headline.main: Transferring to a State University, and Saving Tens of Thousands of Dollars in the Bargain
